study.study_title: Single-cell landscape of bronchoalveolar immune cells in patients with COVID-19
study.lab_name: Zheng Zhang
study.study_description: Respiratory immune characteristics associated with Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19) severity are currently unclear. We characterized bronchoalveolar lavage fluid immune cells from patients with varying severity of COVID-19 and from healthy people by using single-cell RNA sequencing. Proinflammatory monocyte-derived macrophages were abundant in the bronchoalveolar lavage fluid from patients with severe COVID-9. Moderate cases were characterized by the presence of highly clonally expanded CD8+ T cells. This atlas of the bronchoalveolar immune microenvironment suggests potential mechanisms underlying pathogenesis and recovery in COVID-19.
study.inclusion_exclusion_criteria: This study was conducted according to the principles expressed in the Declaration of Helsinki. Ethical approval was obtained from the Research Ethics Committee of Shenzhen Third People’s Hospital (2020-112). All participants provided written informed consent for sample collection and subsequent analyses.
study.grants: This study was supported by the Science and Technology Innovation Committee of Shenzhen Municipality (202002073000002) and the National Natural Science Foundation of China (91442127 to Z.Z.; 81700540 to Y.L.).
study.collected_by: Mingfeng Liao, Institute for Hepatology, National Clinical Research Center for Infectious Disease, Shenzhen Third People's Hospital, Shenzhen, China
study.lab_address: Institute for Hepatology, National Clinical Research Center for Infectious Disease, Shenzhen Third People's Hospital, Shenzhen, China
study.submitted_by: Scott Christley, scott.christley@utsouthwestern.edu, UT Southwestern Medical Center

sample.tissue_processing: BALF was strained and the cells were re-suspended in RPMI 1640 complete medium.
sample.library_generation_protocol: Total 11 µl of single cell suspension and 40 µl barcoded Gel Beads were loaded to Chromium Chip A to generate single-cell gel bead-in-emulsion (GEM). The poly-adenylated transcripts were reverse-transcribed later. The single-cell capturing and downstream library constructions were performed using the Chromium Single Cell 5' library preparation kit with full length TCR V(D)J segment enrichment with a Chromium Single-Cell V(D)J Enrichment kit. Both kits were used accourding to 10X Genomic's protocol. Full-length cDNA along with cell-barcode identifiers were PCR-amplified and sequencing libraries were prepared and normalized to 3 nM.
sample.library_generation_kit_version: Chromium Single Cell V(D)J Reagent kits (10x Genomics; PN-1000006, PN-1000014, PN-1000020, PN-1000005)

study.study_title: Liao et al., Single-cell landscape of bronchoalveolar immune cells in patients with COVID-19
study.lab_name: Institute for Hepatology, National Clinical Research Center for Infectious Disease, Shenzhen Third People's Hospital
study.study_description: The atlas of the bronchoalveolar immune microenvironment suggests potential mechanisms underlying pathogenesis and recovery in COVID-19.
study.inclusion_exclusion_criteria: Include: COVID + Exclude: Influenza A and B virus infection
study.lab_address: Shenzhen Third People's Hospital, Shenzhen, China

sample.tissue_processing: BALF was strained and the cells were re-suspended in RPMI 1640 complete medium.
sample.library_generation_protocol: Total 11 µl of single cell suspension and 40 µl barcoded Gel Beads were loaded to Chromium Chip A to generate single-cell gel bead-in-emulsion (GEM). The poly-adenylated transcripts were reverse-transcribed later. The single-cell capturing and downstream library constructions were performed using the Chromium Single Cell 5' library preparation kit with full length TCR V(D)J segment enrichment with a Chromium Single-Cell V(D)J Enrichment kit. Both kits were used accourding to 10X Genomic's protocol. Full-length cDNA along with cell-barcode identifiers were PCR-amplified and sequencing libraries were prepared and normalized to 3 nM.
sample.library_generation_kit_version: Chromium Single Cell V(D)J Reagent kits (10x Genomics; PN-1000006, PN-1000014, PN-1000020, PN-1000005)

data_processing.data_processing_protocols: Processing by authors: TCR sequences for each single T cell were assembled by Cell Ranger vdj pipeline (v.3.1.0). Cells with both TCR α- and β-chains were kept and cells with only one TCR chain were discarded. For cells with more than one α- or β-chain, the chain with higher UMIs or reads was kept. Annotation and data processing (removal of mixed Ig/TR annotations) by Sorbonne Université: mixcr align -s {params.species} -p {params.alignment_parameter} --report {log} {input.samplei} {output.alignF} mixcr exportAlignments -c {params.chain} -vHit -dHit -jHit -vGene -dGene -jGene -vFamily -dFamily -jFamily -vHitScore -dHitScore -jHitScore -nFeature CDR3 -aaFeature CDR3 -lengthOf CDR3 -readIds {input.sample1} {output.result}. Sorbonne data processing command not present. Data processing (removal of mixed TRA/TRB annotations) by iReceptor: for f in *ireceptor.txt; do base=$(basename $f .txt); head -n 1 $f > $base-TRAV.txt; egrep 'TRAV' $f | egrep -v TRB[DJ][0-9] >> $base-TRAV.txt; done

The single-cell capturing and downstream library constructions were performed using the Chromium Single Cell 5' library preparation kit with full length TCR V(D)J segment enrichment with a Chromium Single-Cell V(D)J Enrichment kit. Both kits were used accourding to 10X Genomic's protocol. Full-length cDNA along with cell-barcode identifiers were PCR-amplified and sequencing libraries were prepared and normalized to 3 nM.
sample.library_generation_kit_version: Chromium Single Cell V(D)J Reagent kits (10x Genomics; PN-1000006, PN-1000014, PN-1000020, PN-1000005)

data_processing.data_processing_protocols: Processing by authors: TCR sequences for each single T cell were assembled by Cell Ranger vdj pipeline (v.3.1.0). Cells with both TCR α- and β-chains were kept and cells with only one TCR chain were discarded. For cells with more than one α- or β-chain, the chain with higher UMIs or reads was kept. Annotation and data processing (removal of mixed Ig/TR annotations) by Sorbonne Université: mixcr align -s {params.species} -p {params.alignment_parameter} --report {log} {input.samplei} {output.alignF} mixcr exportAlignments -c {params.chain} -vHit -dHit -jHit -vGene -dGene -jGene -vFamily -dFamily -jFamily -vHitScore -dHitScore -jHitScore -nFeature CDR3 -aaFeature CDR3 -lengthOf CDR3 -readIds {input.sample1} {output.result}. Sorbonne data processing command not present. Data processing (removal of mixed TRA/TRB annotations) by iReceptor: for f in *ireceptor.txt; do base=$(basename $f .txt); head -n 1 $f > $base-TRBV.txt; egrep 'TRBV' $f >> $base-TRBV.txt; done

Data processing (removal of mixed TRA/TRB annotations) by iReceptor: for f in *ireceptor.txt; do base=$(basename $f .txt); head -n 1 $f > $base-TRAV.txt; egrep 'TRAV' $f | egrep -v TRB[DJ][0-9] >> $base-TRAV.txt; done

study.study_title: Liao et al., Single-cell landscape of bronchoalveolar immune cells in patients with COVID-19
study.lab_name: Institute for Hepatology, National Clinical Research Center for Infectious Disease, Shenzhen Third People's Hospital
study.study_description: The atlas of the bronchoalveolar immune microenvironment suggests potential mechanisms underlying pathogenesis and recovery in COVID-19.
study.inclusion_exclusion_criteria: Include: COVID + Exclude: Influenza A and B virus infection
study.lab_address: Shenzhen Third People's Hospital, Shenzhen, China

sample.tissue_processing: BALF was strained and the cells were re-suspended in RPMI 1640 complete medium.
sample.library_generation_protocol: Total 11 µl of single cell suspension and 40 µl barcoded Gel Beads were loaded to Chromium Chip A to generate single-cell gel bead-in-emulsion (GEM). The poly-adenylated transcripts were reverse-transcribed later. The single-cell capturing and downstream library constructions were performed using the Chromium Single Cell 5' library preparation kit with full length TCR V(D)J segment enrichment with a Chromium Single-Cell V(D)J Enrichment kit. Both kits were used accourding to 10X Genomic's protocol. Full-length cDNA along with cell-barcode identifiers were PCR-amplified and sequencing libraries were prepared and normalized to 3 nM.
sample.library_generation_kit_version: Chromium Single Cell V(D)J Reagent kits (10x Genomics; PN-1000006, PN-1000014, PN-1000020, PN-1000005)

data_processing.data_processing_protocols: Processing by authors: TCR sequences for each single T cell were assembled by Cell Ranger vdj pipeline (v.3.1.0). Cells with both TCR α- and β-chains were kept and cells with only one TCR chain were discarded. For cells with more than one α- or β-chain, the chain with higher UMIs or reads was kept. Annotation and data processing (removal of mixed Ig/TR annotations) by Sorbonne Université: mixcr align -s {params.species} -p {params.alignment_parameter} --report {log} {input.samplei} {output.alignF} mixcr exportAlignments -c {params.chain} -vHit -dHit -jHit -vGene -dGene -jGene -vFamily -dFamily -jFamily -vHitScore -dHitScore -jHitScore -nFeature CDR3 -aaFeature CDR3 -lengthOf CDR3 -readIds {input.sample1} {output.result}. Sorbonne data processing command not present. Data processing (removal of mixed TRA/TRB annotations) by iReceptor: for f in *ireceptor.txt; do base=$(basename $f .txt); head -n 1 $f > $base-TRBV.txt; egrep 'TRBV' $f >> $base-TRBV.txt; done
